facts: The tilapia proceeds to the spot right after the doctorfish.
rules: Rule1: If at least one animal proceeds to the spot right after the doctorfish, then the puffin offers a job to the pig. Rule2: If something removes from the board one of the pieces of the kangaroo, then it does not roll the dice for the polar bear. Rule3: If at least one animal offers a job position to the pig, then the raven rolls the dice for the polar bear.
example: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The tilapia proceeds to the spot right after the doctorfish. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If at least one animal proceeds to the spot right after the doctorfish, then the puffin offers a job to the pig. Rule2: If something removes from the board one of the pieces of the kangaroo, then it does not roll the dice for the polar bear. Rule3: If at least one animal offers a job position to the pig, then the raven rolls the dice for the polar bear. Rule2 is preferred over Rule3. Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the raven roll the dice for the polar bear?
proof: We know the tilapia proceeds to the spot right after the doctorfish, and according to Rule1 "if at least one animal proceeds to the spot right after the doctorfish, then the puffin offers a job to the pig", so we can conclude "the puffin offers a job to the pig". We know the puffin offers a job to the pig, and according to Rule3 "if at least one animal offers a job to the pig, then the raven rolls the dice for the polar bear", and for the conflicting and higher priority rule Rule2 we cannot prove the antecedent "the raven removes from the board one of the pieces of the kangaroo", so we can conclude "the raven rolls the dice for the polar bear". So the statement "the raven rolls the dice for the polar bear" is proved and the answer is "yes".

Rule3: The cockroach unquestionably holds the same number of points as the raven, in the case where the sun bear owes $$$ to the cockroach. Rule4: If you are positive that one of the animals does not become an enemy of the tiger, you can be certain that it will not hold the same number of points as the raven.

Rule3: The cockroach unquestionably holds the same number of points as the raven, in the case where the sun bear owes $$$ to the cockroach. We know the cockroach sings a victory song for the swordfish, and according to Rule1 "if something sings a victory song for the swordfish, then it does not hold the same number of points as the raven", and for the conflicting and higher priority rule Rule3 we cannot prove the antecedent "the sun bear owes money to the cockroach", so we can conclude "the cockroach does not hold the same number of points as the raven". We know the cockroach does not hold the same number of points as the raven and the octopus does not hold the same number of points as the raven, and according to Rule2 "if the cockroach does not hold the same number of points as the raven and the octopus does not holds the same number of points as the raven, then the raven does not burn the warehouse of the grizzly bear", so we can conclude "the raven does not burn the warehouse of the grizzly bear".
